metadata.title: CVE-2020-16011 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap buffer overflow in UI in Google Chrome on Windows prior to86.0.4240.183 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the rendererprocess to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16011` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
